references.paper_title: Imagenet classification with deep convolutional neural networks
references.reason: This paper introduced AlexNet, a groundbreaking deep convolutional neural network that significantly advanced the field of image recognition and served as a foundation for many subsequent deep learning models.

references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This work introduced the ResNet architecture, which addressed the vanishing gradient problem in deep neural networks, enabling the training of significantly deeper and more accurate models for image recognition.

references.paper_title: An image is worth 16x16 words: Transformers for image recognition at scale
references.reason: This paper introduced the Vision Transformer (ViT), which adapted the transformer architecture from natural language processing to image recognition, achieving state-of-the-art performance on several image classification benchmarks.

references.paper_title: Learning to discover novel visual categories via deep transfer clustering
references.reason: This study proposed a deep transfer clustering method for novel category discovery, addressing the challenge of recognizing unseen categories by leveraging knowledge transfer from known categories.

This work addressed the limitations of previous novel category discovery methods by allowing for both known and unknown categories in the unlabeled data, thus generalizing the approach to more realistic scenarios.
